name: The Space Port
description:
Hi everyone,

Firstly I'd like to be upfront and say that this isn't so much a game but more the results of an experiment and a learning experience. The entire thing takes only about 5-10 minutes to play through but everything you see and hear is (mostly) designed and built from scratch. 

Secondly, yes this is basically a love letter to Mos Eisley.

The idea was to build a single level in UE4 while using as many different pieces of the engine as possible such as blueprints, animated textures, sequences, UI, materials, etc, etc. Additionally, it doubled as a way to improve on level design by using points of interest, a sense of scale, world-building, and generally guiding the player to their end goal while not bombarding them with popups.

It's only a wee experience but some of you out there might appreciate it and who knows what it could lead to later down the line! Although small (heh), there was a lot of encouragement and endless enthusiasm tied into this project, thank you.
